definitions: annual anniversary of the day someone was born
celebration or party held to commemorate someone's birth anniversary
examples: Her birthday falls on December 25th this year
We celebrated grandma's ninetieth birthday with the whole family
The birthday party had clowns and a bouncy castle
They threw a surprise birthday for their colleague

definitions: process of giving birth to a baby through labor and delivery
facility or area specifically designed for childbirth and maternity care
examples: The birthing process lasted twelve hours without complications
She attended birthing classes to prepare for natural delivery
The hospital opened a new birthing center last month
Many women prefer birthing suites with homelike atmospheres

definitions: permanent colored mark on skin present from birth or appearing shortly after
examples: The baby had a small birthmark shaped like a strawberry
Her birthmark on her shoulder was barely noticeable

definitions: location where a person was born or something originated
place where an idea, movement, or phenomenon first began or developed
examples: His birthplace was a small village in southern Italy
She returned to visit her birthplace after forty years
Greece is considered the birthplace of Western democracy
Nashville is known as the birthplace of country music

definitions: right or privilege one has from birth, especially as an inheritance
fundamental right considered naturally belonging to all people from birth
examples: The eldest son claimed the estate as his birthright
She sold her birthright for immediate financial gain
Freedom of speech is considered a birthright in democratic societies
Every child's birthright includes access to education and healthcare

definitions: South Asian mixed rice dish with spices, meat or vegetables, and aromatic herbs
examples: The restaurant serves authentic Hyderabadi biryani every Friday
She learned to make vegetable biryani from her grandmother

definitions: small flat baked cake that is typically crisp and sweet
small soft leavened bread popular in Southern United States cuisine
examples: She dipped chocolate biscuits in her afternoon tea
The packet of digestive biscuits was nearly empty
Buttermilk biscuits with gravy make a hearty breakfast
The restaurant serves fresh biscuits with honey butter

definitions: person who is sexually or romantically attracted to both men and women
examples: Many bisexual individuals face unique challenges in dating
The bisexual community seeks greater visibility and acceptance

definitions: sexual or romantic attraction to both men and women as an orientation
examples: Bisexuality exists on a spectrum of attraction and preference
Research on bisexuality challenges binary notions of sexual orientation

definitions: senior member of Christian clergy having authority over priests and churches in a diocese
chess piece that moves diagonally across the board
examples: The bishop consecrated the new cathedral last Sunday
She was appointed as the first female bishop in the diocese
He moved his bishop to protect the queen from attack
The bishop controls the long diagonal across the board

definitions: district under a bishop's control containing multiple churches and parishes
office or position of being a bishop in the church hierarchy
examples: The bishopric encompasses twelve parishes across three counties
Medieval bishoprics often wielded considerable political power
He declined the bishopric to continue his missionary work
The bishopric remained vacant for eighteen months

definitions: brittle metallic chemical element with atomic number 83, used in medicines and cosmetics
examples: Bismuth compounds are used to treat stomach upset and diarrhea
The iridescent crystals contain naturally occurring bismuth

definitions: large wild ox with shaggy hair and humped shoulders native to North America
examples: American bison once roamed the Great Plains in massive herds
The national park protects the last wild bison population

definitions: small informal restaurant serving moderately priced simple meals in a modest setting
examples: The French bistro on the corner serves excellent wine
They opened a cozy bistro specializing in local cuisine

definitions: adult female dog, wolf, fox, or otter
offensive term for a woman considered unpleasant or difficult
complaint or criticism about something considered troublesome
examples: The bitch had a litter of six healthy puppies
The breeder selected the bitch for her excellent bloodline
Using that word as an insult is deeply disrespectful
The term has been reclaimed by some feminist movements
Everyone had a bitch about the new parking regulations
Stop having a bitch about every little inconvenience

definitions: wound inflicted by teeth or mouth of an animal or person
small piece of food taken into the mouth at once
sharp or stinging quality in taste, temperature, or effect
examples: The dog bite required several stitches at the hospital
Mosquito bites covered her arms after the camping trip
Just take one bite of the cake to taste it
He grabbed a quick bite before the meeting started
The bite of winter wind made everyone bundle up
Her sarcastic comments had a real bite to them

definitions: computer graphics image format storing pixels as a grid of individual color values
examples: The bitmap file was too large to email efficiently
Converting vector graphics to bitmap reduces their scalability

definitions: British beer with a hoppy flavor and bitter taste from hops
examples: He ordered a pint of bitter at the local pub
Traditional English bitter has less carbonation than lager

definitions: feeling or situation combining happiness with sadness or pleasure with pain
dark chocolate with little sugar content and pronounced cocoa flavor
examples: Graduation was a bittersweet moment for parents and students
Their reunion after twenty years felt bittersweet
She prefers bittersweet chocolate for baking rich desserts
The recipe calls for four ounces of bittersweet chocolate

definitions: aquatic mollusk with a hinged shell in two parts, including clams, oysters, and mussels
examples: Bivalves filter feed by pumping water through their bodies
The restaurant specializes in fresh bivalves from local waters

definitions: temporary camp without tents or cover, used especially by soldiers or mountaineers
examples: The soldiers set up a bivouac in the forest clearing
Mountain climbers established a bivouac before the final ascent

definitions: publication or event occurring every two weeks or twice a week
examples: The biweekly magazine covers local arts and culture
Our biweekly meetings help track project progress regularly

definitions: informal shortened form of business referring to commercial activity or industry
examples: She's been in show biz for over twenty years
The tech biz moves at an incredibly fast pace

definitions: person who talks too much or reveals secrets and confidential information
examples: Don't tell him anything secret, he's a total blabbermouth
The office blabbermouth spread the news within minutes

definitions: darkest color resulting from absence or complete absorption of light
person of African or African American racial heritage and identity
complete darkness or absence of light in a space
examples: She wore an elegant black dress to the formal dinner
The artist worked exclusively in black and white photography
Black Americans have made enormous contributions to music and culture
The Black community organized to address local concerns
The power outage left the neighborhood in complete black
They waited in the black of night for dawn

definitions: dark purple edible berry growing on thorny bushes of the rose family
brand of smartphone popular in early 2000s known for keyboard and email
examples: Wild blackberries grow along the hiking trail every summer
She made homemade blackberry jam from freshly picked berries
His old Blackberry still works for basic calls and texts
Blackberry devices dominated the business phone market

definitions: common songbird with black plumage, found in Europe, Asia, and North America
examples: A blackbird sang from the garden fence every morning
Male blackbirds have distinctive yellow beaks and eye-rings

definitions: large dark surface, traditionally black or green, for writing with chalk in classrooms
examples: The teacher wrote the equation on the blackboard
Old-fashioned blackboards are being replaced by digital whiteboards

definitions: dark makeup worn to caricature Black people, historically used in racist minstrel shows
examples: Blackface performances perpetuated harmful racial stereotypes for decades
The use of blackface in any context is widely condemned

definitions: casino card game where players try to reach twenty-one points
short leather-covered club with a flexible handle used as a weapon
North American oak tree with dark bark and wood
examples: She won five hundred dollars playing blackjack in Vegas
The dealer must stand on seventeen in blackjack
Police found an illegal blackjack during the vehicle search
Carrying a blackjack is prohibited in many jurisdictions
The blackjack tree provides excellent hardwood for furniture making
Blackjack oaks are common in the southeastern United States

definitions: list of people or things considered unacceptable or untrustworthy and excluded from privileges
examples: The company maintains a blacklist of unreliable suppliers
Hollywood's communist blacklist destroyed many careers in the 1950s

definitions: crime of demanding money through threats to reveal embarrassing information
use of threats or manipulation to force someone to do something
examples: The executive faced blackmail over compromising photographs
Blackmail carries serious criminal penalties including imprisonment
Using guilt as emotional blackmail damages healthy relationships
Children sometimes use tears as blackmail to get their way

definitions: person who commits blackmail by threatening to reveal damaging information for gain
examples: The blackmailer demanded fifty thousand dollars in unmarked bills
Police arrested the blackmailer after a lengthy investigation

definitions: failure of electrical power supply over a wide area
temporary loss of consciousness or memory
suppression of information or broadcasting, especially during wartime
examples: The summer blackout affected millions across the northeastern states
Rolling blackouts help prevent total grid failure during peak demand
He experienced a blackout after drinking too much alcohol
The patient suffered brief blackouts due to low blood pressure
The government imposed a media blackout during the military operation
Social media platforms faced criticism for news blackouts

definitions: craftsperson who forges and shapes iron using hammer and anvil, traditionally making horseshoes
examples: The village blacksmith still makes custom ironwork by hand
Historical reenactors demonstrate traditional blacksmith techniques at the fair

definitions: thorny shrub with white flowers and blue-black fruit, used for making sloe gin
examples: The blackthorn hedge blooms with white flowers in early spring
Walking sticks made from blackthorn wood are particularly sturdy

definitions: muscular sac in humans and animals that stores urine from the kidneys
inflatable bag or sac used in various devices and equipment
examples: The bladder can hold about two cups of urine comfortably
Bladder infections are more common in women than men
The soccer ball's rubber bladder holds the air inside
Fish use their swim bladder to control buoyancy

definitions: flat cutting edge of a knife, sword, or other tool
flat wide part of an oar, propeller, or similar implement
skilled ice skater or rollerblader
examples: The knife blade needs sharpening before cutting vegetables
Ancient sword blades were forged from folded steel
The propeller blade was damaged during the storm
Turbine blades must withstand extreme temperatures and forces
Professional blades perform complex tricks at the skate park
The aggressive blades dominated the roller hockey tournament

definitions: meaningless or boring talk or writing lacking substance
feeling of boredom, mild depression, or general dissatisfaction
examples: The speech was just corporate blah about synergy and innovation
Skip the blah and get to the important points
January always gives me the blahs after holiday excitement
She's had the blahs all week and needs cheering up

definitions: responsibility for a fault, error, or wrongdoing assigned to someone
state of being responsible or at fault for something negative
examples: Management took the blame for the project's complete failure
Don't put all the blame on one person
The blame lies with poor planning and communication
She accepted blame for the misunderstanding

definitions: empty space on a document or form to be filled in
cartridge containing powder but no bullet, used for training or effects
state of showing no emotion, understanding, or recognition
examples: Fill in the blanks with the correct answers
Leave this blank if the question doesn't apply to you
The starter pistol fires blanks at track meets
Movie productions use blanks for realistic gunfire scenes
Her face went blank when asked about the incident
His mind drew a complete blank during the exam

definitions: large piece of woven material used for warmth on a bed
thing that covers or affects everything within a particular area or group
examples: She pulled the wool blanket up to her chin
The baby sleeps better with a weighted blanket
The storm left a blanket of snow across the region
They issued a blanket statement denying all allegations

definitions: smooth, flattering, or coaxing talk intended to deceive or persuade
examples: His charming blarney convinced her to lend him money
Don't believe his blarney about being a millionaire

definitions: act or speech showing contempt or lack of reverence for God or sacred things
examples: Some countries still prosecute blasphemy as a criminal offense
The artist's work was condemned as blasphemy by religious leaders

definitions: destructive wave of pressure and debris from an explosion
strong gust of wind or air from a specific source
very enjoyable or exciting experience or event
examples: The blast from the explosion shattered windows blocks away
Bomb blast victims were rushed to nearby hospitals
A blast of cold air hit them when opening the freezer
The trumpet's blast echoed through the concert hall
The birthday party was an absolute blast for everyone
We had a blast at the amusement park yesterday

definitions: person or device that uses explosives for demolition or mining
portable stereo system capable of producing loud music
energy weapon in science fiction media
examples: The mining blaster carefully placed charges in the rock face
Professional blasters need certification to handle explosives
Kids carried boom box blasters on their shoulders in the 1980s
Turn down that ghetto blaster before neighbors complain
The space trooper fired his laser blaster at the aliens
Video game characters often wield plasma blasters

definitions: 1970s film genre featuring Black actors in urban action roles, often criticized for stereotypes
examples: Blaxploitation films like Shaft became cult classics despite controversy
Modern filmmakers reference blaxploitation aesthetics in homages

definitions: large destructive fire burning fiercely and uncontrolled
very bright display of light or color
white mark on an animal's face or a trail marker
examples: Firefighters battled the blaze for twelve hours straight
The warehouse blaze caused millions in damage
The sunset created a blaze of orange across the sky
Her dress was a blaze of sequins and color
The horse had a distinctive white blaze down its face
Hikers follow tree blazes to stay on the trail

definitions: smart casual jacket resembling a suit jacket but worn with non-matching pants
examples: He wore a navy blazer with khaki pants to the club
School uniforms often include blazers with the school crest

definitions: burning fiercely with intense heat and bright flames
showing or characterized by extreme intensity or passion
examples: The blazing sun made outdoor work nearly impossible
Blazing fires consumed thousands of acres of forest
They had a blazing argument that lasted for hours
Her blazing speed broke three track records
